Key:
All right... I still have time. Maybe I should
find someone and invite her out on a date.
Oh crap! I left my gym clothes in the classroom!

Man, I can't believe I'm wasting precious
time on something so stupid! Why am I so
forgetful?!

But I guess if I have time to ramble, then
I might as well go and get them, huh? *sigh*...

*pant, pant* Maybe I haven't gotten much
exercise, but these damn steps are getting
me outta breath. Keep it together, man.

Man, why do I feel so lonely when the
hallways are empty?

I gotta hurry up and get my stuff so that
I can take one of the girls on a date—
(Oh...? Is someone still in the classroom...?)
(...?! O-Origami?!)
(What... is she doing here by herself?)
*inhale, exhale*...
O-Origami...? What are you doing here—
*inhale, exhale*...
Uh, heeeey? Hello? You listening?

(N-No use... She doesn't notice me at
all! What is she cuddling?)
*sniff, sniff*... *sniff, sniff*...

*sniff, sniff*... Yo, what are you smelling?
...! HEY! That's MINE!

(What Origami was sniffing, I discovered,
were my gym clothes I left in the classroom!)
Oh!
Don't... "oh" me!
Would you like a whiff, Shido?
Why would I want to sniff my own clothes?!
Suit yourself.
Huh...?
HEY! U-Um... Origami-san?!
My clothes.
H-Huh...?
Sniff them.
Hell no!
...Shido, you're so greedy.
WHAT?! Hey, wait! STOOOOOP!
Huh?
Why are you taking off your clothes?!
Because you're dissatisfied with my shirt.
That's not what I meant!

I see. Perhaps I need to remove another
layer then...
S-STOP! Please, just hear me out!

No problem. There's no scent like the one
of a freshly removed shirt.
Like I said, that's not what I mea—
Pull it down.
Huh...?
Your zipper.
Aah... AAAAAAAH! I-I'm sorrrryyyyy!
Oh...
Wh-What a relief... She didn't run after me.

(Phew. Looks like I got away from her, but
now it seems to be too late to ask someone out
on a date. Darn it.)
Oh, Kotori?
So? How's it going? Doesn't look like\nanything's changed on this side.

W-Well, um... I sort of had a situation with
Origami. I think it's too late to go on a date
now, so I was considering going home.
...I see.

(Huh...? That's weird. She would've normally
started chewing me out by now.)
K-Kotori...? What the—?!
Very well. Let's add Origami Tobiichi as\na potential date target.
E-Excuse me?!
Origami Tobiichi might not be a Spirit,\nbut there's still risk associated with her.
You mean because she's a member of the AST?
That's the only thing that could exclude her as\na potential date candidate. Unless you want to\ndate her personally, Shido. That's different.
Rngh!
Shido, you know what she did before, right?
Yeah...
She attacked me in front of civilians. She did\nit... with the intent to kill. For now, it seems\nlike she's let it go...
Her punishment has yet to be determined,\nbut if she's going to be dismissed, there's a\nchance she'll become unstable.
Oh...
She's in a precarious state. The AST enables\nher to enact her revenge. Without them, though,\nwho knows what'll become of her?
?! Th-That'd be horrible!

(It all makes sense. Origami, is the stress
starting to get to you...?)
Well, that's something to consider. If we\nleave her be, she might try to steal weapons\nfrom the AST base and make another attempt.
(She's got a point. That could happen.)
Her emotions need to be stabilized, or else she\nmay provoke the other Spirits. With everyone's\ninstability, I'd like to avoid that, so—

You want me to go on a date with her, right?
Whatever the reason, if it involves helping
Origami... I'll do it.
What? Sounds like you've got serious feelings\nfor her.
D-Don't put it like that! This IS serious!
I know. Shido, I had a feeling you'd say\nthat anyway.
Jeez... You're barely able to care for the\nSpirits. You're a fool.
Hey, don't call me a fool!
Listen to me, Shido. You tend to drag your\nfeet with stuff like—
Yeah, yeah! Got it! I'm not all that!
Just shut up and listen.
Huh...?
If you get the chance to go on a date with\nOrigami and get some information on the\nAST, then take it.
A-Are you asking me to be... a spy?
Well, if the boot fits.

Wait. Was that why you wanted me to go on
the date in the first place?
Don't get me wrong. Our priority is to\nstabilize her emotional state.

However, no doubt AST realizes what's
going on as well. In order to resolve the
situation, I can't afford to miss any intel."	
Message	Shido	Kotori...	
Message	Kotori	Well, if Ratatoskr was functioning as normal,\nany bizarre tactics used against us wouldn't\nfaze me, but I guess it isn't the case for now."

But do you really think I could fool her?
Besides, Origami could be terminated from
AST, right? Then—
Don't worry. I've got little faith in you.
H-Hey!
Well, worst-case scenario, you don't have to\nproduce results. It'd just be a bonus.

(Ugh... I don't appreciate her claim of
having little faith in me.)
You seem taken aback. Wanna call it quits?

I... I'll do it. If there's a chance I can
reduce Origami's worries—however small—then
I'll go on a date with her. But no promises.
Sure, works with me. Just... if she starts\nacting suspicious again, don't try to fix it\nyourself. Give us a heads up.
O-Okay...
All right. Let's get to it.
Phew... This is becoming an ordeal.

(It's true, though, that Origami is unstable.
Maybe inviting her to dates on occasion could
help.)
Shido...
WHOA!!!! O-Origami?!
You've... forgotten your stuff.

Oh... Th-That’s right. Th-Thanks Origami!
I totally forgot to grab them—Hm?
(My gym bag feels conspicuously light...)
I'll wash the clothes.
...! P-Please... Give them back!

Do you plan on asking Rinne Sonogami to
wash them?

Huh? No. I planned on washing them myself.
Why would you bring Rinne up?
Because she's your wife.
Huh...?
Nothing... Never mind.
Oh, hey, Origami!
...She took my clothes.

Uh... I-I didn't see anything. Yeah, I'll do
that...

*sigh*... I can only imagine what's going
to happen.
